body.p:
Hopkinsville Ky
March 22d 1861
Govenor B. Magoffin
Frankfort Ky
Dear Sir

From the enclosed documents you find we are anxious your clemency should be exercised towards one George Long -- a free man of color -- yesterday sentenced to 3 months imprisonment & $100 fine for an assault upon one Louis Kinstler of our town.

The sympathies of our people (without exception so far as I know) are for the negro -- The Jury were unacquainted with the parties as also with the circumstances leading to the affray -- The negro was convicted upon the testimony of Kinstler alone= I would say more -- but I say enough when I assure you that many of our best citizens & all with whom I have spoken, desire that the negro shall be released

The Petition sent you contains
many names known to you -- The very best in our community -- none others being desired, & Those only sent you that you may be the better assured of the truth of the statements herein

I remain
As ever
Truly yr friend
John S Bryan
